title: Calories in a Persian Cucumber
meta_description: Learn calories in a Persian cucumber, plus carbs, fiber, protein, and full nutrition breakdown per serving with quick tips.
assumptions: Fresh, raw, medium-sized (approx. 100 g), seedless variety.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, variety, freshness, and growing conditions. Check produce labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One medium Persian cucumber has about 16 calories and provides hydration with minimal carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Sliced into salad with 1 tsp olive oil

faqs.q: How many calories are in a Persian cucumber?
faqs.a: About 16 calories for one medium (100 g) Persian cucumber.

faqs.q: Are Persian cucumbers low in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, only 3.6 g carbs per 100 g, mostly from natural sugars.

faqs.q: What's the difference in nutrition between Persian and regular cucumbers?
faqs.a: Similar profiles; Persian are often smaller, seedless, and slightly lower in fiber but equally low-calorie.

faqs.q: How much fiber is in a Persian cucumber?
faqs.a: Approximately 0.5 g dietary fiber per 100 g, aiding digestion.

faqs.q: Are Persian cucumbers good for weight loss?
faqs.a: Yes, they're low-calorie (16 kcal/100 g), high-water, and provide vitamins like K and C.
